attributes.comment:
I am writing because of my concern in increasing rates for adoptions. My sister
and her husband are trying to adopt their second child from China. They have
submitted all their paperwork. It has been approved and they are only awaiting the
referral.

It seems incredibly unfair to charge them again, essentially more than double, for
nothing more than issuing them the same paperwork for work that has already
been done. Just because the Hague Treaty and the delay in processing by the
county of adoption, does not make it right to charge them again for no added
benefit.

My sister's family and hundreds of others are trying to do thing legally and above
board. The proposal as it is, is counterproductive and appears to be punishment
for trying to do the right thing

Thank you for your consideration.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Robert Wilson
